title: Updates: Mid-air crash in Buckinghamshire - BBC News
summary: four people have died after a light aircraft and a helicopter crashed in mid-air over buckinghamshire .
emergency services were called to the crash site near waddesdon manor , aylesbury , at 12:06 gmt .
thames valley police said two of the dead were in each aircraft .
both aircraft involved came from nearby wycombe air park .
the air accidents investigation branch is investigating .

documents.title: halting our live updates
text: our live updates following today 's mid-air crash in buckinghamshire are coming to an end .
keep your eyes posted on the bbc news website for the latest updates overnight and across the weekend .
we 'll leave you with a brief update on this story , telling you what we know so far :

documents.title: 'too early to tell ' cause of waddesdon crash
text: as we 've been reporting , police say it is `` too early to tell '' what caused an air crash on the waddesdon estate in buckinghamshire .
supt rebecca mears from thames valley police said : `` our priority has to be with the next-of-kin , speaking to them and letting them know .
`` we anticipate being here until about monday morning , potentially longer .
we do not rush these things - it 's really important we do a meticulous investigation and really thorough to get to the bottom of what 's happened here . ''
forensic tents ( have been put up by police at the scene .

the press association reports that a notice to airmen had been issued to warn pilots the wycombe air park 's air traffic control services would be closed during three 30-minute periods on selected days between 7 - 30 november , due to a `` staff shortage '' .
the crash occurred about half an hour after the latest closure was due to end , it said .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: estate worker describes 'burning wreckage '
text: waddesdon estate gardener , len bellis , described how he found the `` burning wreckage '' of the air crash minutes later .
he had been working nearby when he heard a `` horrendous noise '' , like a tin hangar collapsing .
he said two men came running towards him from the woods shouting , `` did you see it , did you see it ? ''
mr bellis said one of them told him he heard a plane `` stuttering '' just before the crash .
`` i just came across the wreckage , '' said mr bellis , who described the light aircraft as a `` wreck '' and `` non-existent '' , apart from the 5ft ( 1.5m ) burning fuselage .

documents.title: four dead in helicopter and plane crash
text: four dead in helicopter and plane crash

documents.title: 'loud bang ' shock of rothschild family member
text: a member of the rothschild family at waddesdon manor has told of her shock after lunchtime 's mid-air collision between a helicopter and an aircraft missed her by five minutes .
the woman , who did not want her full name published , told the press association she heard a loud bang while she was driving her car to a dog grooming event , near waddesdon , in buckinghamshire .
just five minutes earlier she had been a plant in the wilderness woods , the scene of the crash site , on the waddesdon estate .
`` i 'm totally shocked , '' she said .
`` i heard a loud bang , which i thought was a car crash . ''

documents.title: crash site a 'big scene '
text: talking to the press , supt mears continued that the crash happened on the waddesdon estate , which is a `` big scene '' , adding that police needed to spend time `` gathering all evidence possible '' .
she said it was `` too early to tell '' what might have caused the aircraft and helicopter to collide .

`` our priorities today remain with investigating the next-of-kin , finding out who they are , informing them and supporting them with specialist officers as we progress the investigation here on site , '' she added .

documents.title: investigation at scene of crash continues
text: police are likely to remain at the scene of the plane crash at waddesdon until monday .
thames valley police supt rebecca mears said : `` i anticipate to be on site until monday morning to do a meticulous investigation and get to the bottom of what happened here . ''

documents.title: four dead included two in the light aircraft and two in the helicopter
text: the four fatalities included two people in each aircraft , police have told a press conference at the scene of today 's crash .
the genders and identities have not been revealed , but police are tracking next-of-kin .

documents.title: breakingfour confirmed dead in air crash
text: four people have died following a mid-air crash between a helicopter and a two-seater light aircraft near waddesdon , buckinghamshire , thames valley police superintendent rebecca mears said .

documents.title: bercow expresses 'shock ' at air crash
text: buckingham mp and speaker of the house of commons , john bercow , has spoken about today 's air crash , telling the bbc : `` i 'm shocked by the news .
it 's a very sad day for waddesdon and for buckinghamshire , and , of course , it 's a very sad day for the casualties of this awful crash and all of their family and loved ones .
`` the sense of shock and outrage at what has happened will be very real and we applaud and appreciate the enormous efforts of the emergency services at a time like this . ''

documents.title: waddesdon manor : a background
text: waddesdon manor , close to the crash site , is a country house near the village of waddesdon in buckinghamshire .
it is managed by the rothschild foundation , a family charitable trust , on behalf of the national trust , which took over ownership in 1957 .

it was built between 1874 and 1889 in the neo-renaissance style of a french chateau for baron ferdinand de rothschild , who used it as a summer and weekend residence at which to entertain friends and family .
a descendant , beth rothschild , still lives on the estate .
nowadays it is a popular attraction , with more than 390,000 visitors annually .

documents.title: possible press briefing
text: we anticipate a press briefing is going to be held by thames valley police near the crash site at some point soon , to update us on the latest in its investigation .
as and when we have more , we 'll bring it to you .

documents.title: recap : what we know so far
text: recap : what we know so far

documents.title: eyewitness : 'we heard a massive crash '
text: andy parry , a teacher in aylesbury , said he was with two students visiting waddesdon manor when they heard a bang and saw debris falling from the sky .
`` we were walking round the gardens of waddesdon manor .
we saw two black objects in the sky .
we heard a massive bang , '' he said .
`` we did n't realise it was a plane at first .
debris was in the sky and the plane span round towards the trees , then we heard a massive crash .
it happened really quickly .
`` it was about a mile away from waddesdon manor . ''

documents.title: visible police presence throughout the day
text: when i got to the scene , it was all a bit frantic .
the assembled media across all outlets , local and national , turned up to a road closed just close to the manor .
it was a logistical nightmare for the manor and the police .
as it 's now dark , we can see light where the air accidents investigation branch and police are .
it 's about 30m ( 100ft ) from the road , which takes you from upper winchendon to waddesdon .
the police presence has been very visible throughout the day .
there 's been talk of a smell of smoke around the area at the time from the crash itself .
the crash appears to have been on the waddesdon estate rather than the grounds of the manor .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC News

documents.title: eyewitness : 'i looked up as they both collided in mid-air '
text: mitch missen , an off-duty firefighter who lives near the crash site , has been speaking to us about what he saw .
`` i looked up and saw as both collided in mid-air , followed by a large bang and falling debris , '' he said .
`` i rushed in to get my car keys and en route called the emergency services , who i continued to give updates as to its whereabouts .
`` as an off-duty firefighter i knew what was needed at the scene .
unfortunately i was n't able to locate the actual crash site but directed police , fire and ambulance as best i could .
`` once they were on the scene i returned home .
let 's just hope everyone is safe , but looking at the and witnessing the tragedy it 's going to be a sad outcome . ''

documents.title: road near cordon reopens
text: police have reopened the road near the crash site , but have put up signs warning drivers of the cordon outside an entrance to waddesdon manor .
the assembled media are the other side of the entrance , close to the busy road that takes drivers from upper winchendon to waddesdon .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC News

documents.title: aircraft 'may have been in blind spot '
text: a mid-air crash over buckinghamshire may have occurred because the pilots were in each other 's blind spots , a former pilot has said .

david learmount , an aviation journalist and former raf pilot - who knows the area well - said both aircraft would have been flying in `` uncontrolled airspace '' close to the ground , where air traffic control is not responsible for separating them .
he told bbc radio oxford `` you can talk to air traffic control if you like '' in such areas , but the pilots would have been responsible for their own `` separation '' .
he said visibility was good and usually when collisions like this happen it is a result of one of the pilots getting `` distracted '' or because both aircraft were in `` each other 's blind spot '' .
author: BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: what is a cessna 152 ?
text: home duty editor alison hodgkins-brown said it 's believed the light aircraft involved was a cessna 152 .
this model - an example of which is below - is a two-seater plane , commonly used for flight training and personal use .

documents.title: aerial shots show mid-air crash scene
text: aerial shots show mid-air crash scene

documents.title: cameraman jumps into bushes to view crash site
text: it 's now completely pitch black in buckinghamshire .
the last person i saw come down the road i 'm on near the crash site was a cyclist just going about his normal business .
it 's eerily quiet now , other than journalists moving about and cameramen trying to get their best shots .
i 've just seen one literally jump into a bunch of bushes in a bid to sneak a peak at the police scene .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC News

documents.title: latest images from air crash scene
text: this was the scene a short while ago

documents.title: 'up to four casualties ' in air crash
text: home duty editor allie hodgkins-brown tweets
believes there may be up to four casualties after an aircraft ( cessna 152 ) & 2-seater helicopter crashed in mid-air over bucks .
ca n't be more than 4 as that cessna only holds 2 people
helicopter too
2 in helicopter and 2 in plane ca n't be more than 4 is what i meant
and what about people on the ground ?
( admittedly it was in woodland but still )
point taken but had ruled out myself

documents.title: aircraft 'may have been in uncontrolled airspace '
text: a plane and helicopter which collided in mid-air over buckinghamshire could have be flying in `` uncontrolled airspace '' , according to a former air accident investigator .
tony cable told bbc radio oxford they could have been `` below '' an area of controlled airspace .
air traffic control does not cover all airspace , and in such situations collision avoidance relies on `` see and be seen '' , he said .
`` all aircraft have blind areas you might be in a helicopter descending , well generally you ca n't see downwards very well , so you might descend on to another aircraft . ''
mr cable , who used to fly in the area , also said it was a location where pilots might go to practice manoeuvres .
author: BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: still no word on the number of casualties
text: now that the evening is setting in you can just about make out the lights being used to help investigate the scene through the dense woodland .
the police have now cordoned off the road , stopping any traffic from coming in .
still no word from the police over the number of people involved in the incident .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC News

documents.title: cessna aircraft involved in crash , say investigators
text: the air accidents investigation branch has just confirmed that a cessna light aircraft was involved in today 's crash with a helicopter , but has not confirmed the precise model .
author: Kate Scotter
BBC News

documents.title: image shows wing in wooded area
text: this is the latest image from the scene of today 's mid-air crash near waddesdon , buckinghamshire .
there is still no word on how many people were on board the helicopter and light aircraft , which collided at just after 12:00 .

documents.title: recap : what we know so far
text: recap : what we know so far

documents.title: at the scene : 'crash site obscured by dense woodland '
text: there is a lot of police activity and fire crews are driving up and down the road .
you can not see the crash site as the woodland is so dense and there are people here climbing through to try to see if they can see more .
there is no plume of smoke and i am 30m ( 98ft ) from where the police have set up a cordon in a field where police are doing some work .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC News

documents.title: where did the crash happen ?
text: emergency services said the mid-air crash happened near waddesdon in buckinghamshire , but waddesdon manor tweeted claiming it was actually closer to the village of upper winchendon , about 1.5 miles ( 2.5km ) to the south .

documents.title: at the scene : cordon in place
text: i 've just arrived in the waddesdon area , and this is the scene at the edge of a police cordon near the site of today 's reported mid-air crash .
officers are n't letting anyone much closer to the scene than this .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC News

documents.title: mid-air crash happened in 'very busy area '
text: aviation journalist david learmount said that mid-air collisions are rare but can happen .
`` it 's actually a very busy area for light aircraft , with lots of small aerodromes where gliding takes place , '' he said .
`` however , the pilots who fly there should be well aware of this and be keeping a very close look out .
`` they normally fly between 1,000 and 2,500ft ( 305-760m ) so that they do n't have to be under the strict control of air traffic control .
`` aviators have to keep their heads moving around all the time because an aircraft could appear suddenly out of nowhere . ''

documents.title: police 'aware of a number of casualties ' following incident
text: we 're aware of a number of casualties following an incident this afternoon in waddesdon , aylesbury .
there were a number of road closures following the incident , which have now been lifted .
we will provide further updates when available .
they should n't have been flying if air traffic control was closed surely ?
it was only 30 mins .
so very sad for families .
my heart goes out to them x
so sad
must be an awful job to attend to .
my heart goes out to everyone affected .
what happened last night during xmas light switch on ?
my little boy was there and his mum text me saying they got made to leave ?

documents.title: eyewitness : 'the area is difficult to get to '
text: the rev mary cruddas , from st mary magdalene church , upper winchendon has told us : i have just been to the crash site to see if i can be of any help .
the area where it happened is off road and difficult to get to .
our thoughts and prayers are with the people involved .
`` the police on site told me to call the incident room to speak about how i can help now and in the future . ''

documents.title: mid-air crash : latest photos from the scene
text: the bbc helicopter has been flying over the scene of the mid-air collision near waddesdon manor in buckinghamshire .

documents.title: emergency services are 'in the process of saving lives '
text: aviation expert julian bray has said it seems emergency services have n't given up hope in finding survivors .
`` they 're saying this is a rescue operation - it is n't recovery - which means they 're in the process of saving lives , '' he said .
`` the whole operation is being co-ordinated by thames valley police and all emergency services are on the scene . ''

documents.title: what is wycombe air park ?
text: both aircraft are believed to have taken off from wycombe air park , also known as booker airfield .
it 's an aerodrome 2.4 miles ( 3.9km ) south-west of high wycombe and is used by various aircraft including gliders , rotary wing aircraft and vintage aircraft .
its website says it looks after 200 aircraft for club members and also offers flight training .

documents.title: breaking'number of casualties ' from air crash
text: south central ambulance service said the air crash in buckinghamshire had caused `` a number of casualties '' .
a spokeswoman said : `` we received the call at 12.09pm for a mid-air collision involving a helicopter and an aircraft in upper winchendon , near aylesbury .
`` we sent a number of resources to the scene , including a thames valley air ambulance , two ambulance crews , two ambulance officers and a rapid response vehicle .
`` there have been a number of casualties at the scene , but at this stage this is all we are able to confirm . ''

documents.title: waddesdon manor tweets visitors 'safe '
text: waddesdon manor has claimed in a tweet that the collision happened at upper winchendon , which is about 1.5miles ( 2.5km ) from the village of waddesdon .
it also confirmed that all visitors to the manor house were safe .
helicopter involved in mid-air collision with an aircraft over waddesdon , buckinghamshire
please be clear that it happened at upper winchendon and not at waddesdon manor where all visitors are safe .
a poorly worded reply there @ twitterid
apart from the ones takin part in the satanic rituals there
my first thought was a heli and aircraft crashed into a castle horrific no matter what but glad it 's not more .
there 's some shockingly lazy journalism around this story !
glad to hear everyone safe at waddesdon and thoughts with those who are involved

documents.title: where the crash happened
text: both aircraft are believed to have taken off from wycombe air park , near high wycombe , and crashed in mid-air over waddesdon .

documents.title: both aircraft 'came from wycombe air park '
text: both aircraft involved in today 's mid-air collision near waddesdon are understood to have come from wycombe air park , according to the press association .

it quotes a spokesman for the airstrip as saying : `` wycombe air park can confirm that at 12 o'clock local today we were informed of an incident north-west of aylesbury involving two aircraft from wycombe air park . ''

documents.title: reporter sent to crash scene
text: we 've dispatched a reporter to waddesdon where an aircraft and helicopter have crashed in mid-air , according to the air accidents investigation branch .
we 'll bring you more from the scene when they arrive .

text: the air accidents investigation branch is sending a team to investigate a mid-air collision involving an aircraft and a helicopter near # aylesbury

documents.title: where is crash site ?
text: an aircraft and a helicopter are believed to have crashed in mid-air over waddesdon , which is six miles north-west of aylesbury in buckinghamshire and 12 miles south-east of bicester in oxfordshire .

documents.title: aircraft and helicopter in 'mid-air crash ' near aylesbury
text: we 've received reports that an aircraft and a helicopter have crashed in mid-air over buckinghamshire .
emergency services were called to the site near waddesdon hall , close to aylesbury , just after midday .
stay posted for live updates .
